<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Torch Goblin](/Feats.aspx?ID=1005) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Goblin" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=81" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 38 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Charhide Goblin](/Heritages.aspx?ID=16) heritage

</column>

---

You’ve spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage. You can light yourself thoroughly on fire with a held [torch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60), a bottle of [alchemist’s fire](/Equipment.aspx?ID=75), or a similar incendiary, dealing yourself 1d6 persistent fire damage. As long as you are suffering persistent fire damage, all your melee attacks against adjacent creatures deal an additional 1 fire damage per weapon damage die. Any creature that successfully [Grapples](/Actions.aspx?ID=35), [Shoves](/Actions.aspx?ID=38), or [Trips](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) you takes 1d6 fire damage; if it uses a weapon for that action, the weapon takes the damage instead. You must still attempt the flat check to remove the persistent fire damage each round, as normal.

<title level="2">Torch Goblin leads to...</title>
[Scalding Spit](/Feats.aspx?ID=1010)
name: Torch Goblin
